englishNarrator: Narrated Jabir bin `Abdullah رضی اللہ عنہما :
hadithEnglish: `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ used to say, "Abu Bakr رضی اللہ عنہ is our chief, and he manumitted our chief," meaning Bilal رضی اللہ عنہ .
Bilal رضی اللہ عنہ said to Abu Bakr رضی اللہ عنہ , "If you have bought me for yourself then keep me (for yourself), but if you have bought me for Allah's Sake, then leave me for Allah's Work."

The prophet ﷺ cuddled me to his chest and said: O Allah! Teach him wisdom. Abu Mamar narrated us this Hadith and he said: O Allah! Teach him wisdom. Abu Mamar narrated us this Hadith and he said Abu Warith narrated us this Hadith that he ﷺsaid: Teach him the Book. Musa narrated us this Hadith and Wohaib narrated him the Hadith like this from Khalid.

The Prophet (ﷺ) had informed the people about the death of Zaid, Ja`far and Ibn Rawaha رضی اللہ عنہم before the news of their death reached them. He said with his eyes flowing with tears, "Zaid رضی اللہ عنہ took the flag and was martyred; then Ja`far رضی اللہ عنہ took the flag and was martyred, and then Ibn Rawaha رضی اللہ عنہ took the flag and was martyred. Finally the flag was taken by one of Allah's Swords (i.e. Khalid bin Al-Walid رضی اللہ عنہ) and Allah gave them (i.e. the Muslims) victory."

`Abdullah (bin Mas`ud رضی اللہ عنہما) was mentioned before `Abdullah bin `Amr رضی اللہ عنہما . The latter said, "That is a man I continue to love because I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, ' Learn the recitation of the Qur'an from (any of these) four persons: `Abdullah bin Masud رضی اللہ عنہما , Salim the freed slave of Abu Hudhaifa رضی اللہ عنہ , Ubai bin Ka`b, and Mu`adh bin Jabal رضی اللہ عنہم ." I do not remember whether he mentioned Ubai first or Mu`adh.

Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) neither talked in an insulting manner nor did he ever speak evil intentionally. He used to say, "The most beloved to me amongst you is the one who has the best character and manners." He added, " Learn the Qur'an from (any of these) four persons. `Abdullah bin Mas`ud رضی اللہ عنہما , Salim the freed slave of Abu Hudhaifa رضی اللہ عنہ , Ubai bin Ka`b, and Mu`adh bin Jabal رضی اللہ عنہ."

I went to Sham and was offering a two-rak`at prayer; I said, "O Allah! Bless me with a (pious) companion." Then I saw an old man coming towards me, and when he came near I said, (to myself), "I hope Allah has given me my request." The man asked (me), "Where are you from?" I replied, "I am from the people of Kufa." He said, "Weren't there amongst you the Carrier of the (Prophet's) shoes, Siwak and the ablution water container? Weren't there amongst you the man who was given Allah's Refuge from the Satan? And weren't there amongst you the man who used to keep the (Prophet's) secrets which nobody else knew? How did Ibn Um `Abd (i.e. `Abdullah bin Mas`ud رضی اللہ عنہما ) use to recite Surat-al-lail (the Night:92)?" I recited:-- "By the Night as it envelops By the Day as it appears in brightness. And by male and female." (92.1- 3) On that, Abu Darda said, "By Allah, the Prophet (ﷺ) made me read the Verse in this way after listening to him, but these people (of Sham) tried their best to let me say something different."

We asked Hudhaifa رضی اللہ عنہ to tell us of a person resembling (to some extent) the Prophet (ﷺ) in good appearance and straight forward behavior so that we may learn from him (good manners and acceptable conduct). Hudhaifa replied, "I do not know anybody resembling the Prophet (to some extent) in appearance and conduct more than Ibn Um `Abd.

englishNarrator: Narrated Abu Musa Al-Ash`ari رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: My brother and I came from Yemen, and for some time we continued to consider `Abdullah bin Mas`ud رضی اللہ عنہما as one of the members of the family of the Prophet (ﷺ) because we used to see him and his mother going in the house of the Prophet (ﷺ) very often.

Muawiya رضی اللہ عنہ offered one rak`a witr prayer after the `Isha prayer, and at that time a freed slave of Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہما was present. He (i.e. the slave) went to Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہما (and told him that Muawiya رضی اللہ عنہ offered one rak`a witr prayer). Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہما said, "Leave him, for he was in the company of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)."

Somebody said to Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہما , "Can you speak to the chief of the believers Mu`awiyah رضی اللہ عنہ , as he does not pray except one rak`a as witr?" Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہما replied, "He is a Faqih (i.e. a learned man who can give religious verdicts) ."

Muawiya رضی اللہ عنہ said (to the people), "You offer a prayer which we, who were the companions of the Prophet (ﷺ) never saw the Prophet (ﷺ) offering, and he forbade its offering," i.e. the two rak`at after the compulsory `Asr prayer.

englishNarrator: Narrated Al-Miswar bin Makhrama رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Fatima is a part of me, and whoever makes her angry, makes me angry."

"Once Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said (to me), 'O Aish (`Aisha)! This is Gabriel greeting you.' I said, 'Peace and Allah's Mercy and Blessings be on him, you see what I don't see' " She was addressing Allah 's Apostle.

englishNarrator: Narrated Abu Musa Al-Ash`ari رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Many amongst men attained perfection but amongst women none attained the perfection except Mary, the daughter of `Imran and Asiya, the wife of Pharaoh. And the superiority of `Aisha to other women is like the superiority of Tharid (i.e. an Arabic dish) to other meals."

englishNarrator: Narrated Anas bin Malik رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "The superiority of `Aisha رضی اللہ عنہا over other women is like the superiority of Tharid to other meals."

Once `Aisha رضی اللہ عنہا became sick and Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہما went to see her and said, "O mother of the believers! You are leaving for truthful fore-runners i.e. for Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and Abu Bakr.

When `Ali رضی اللہ عنہ sent `Ammar and Al-Hasan رضی اللہ عنہما to (the people of) Kufa to urge them to fight, `Ammar رضی اللہ عنہ addressed them saying, "I know that she (i.e. `Aisha رضی اللہ عنہا) is the wife of the Prophet (ﷺ) in this world and in the Hereafter (world to come), but Allah has put you to test, whether you will follow Him (i.e. Allah) or her."

That she borrowed a necklace from Asma' رضی اللہ عنہا and it was lost. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent some of his companions to look for it. During their journey the time of prayer was due and they prayed without ablution. When they returned to the Prophet (ﷺ) they complained about it. So the Divine Verse of Tayammum was revealed. Usaid bin Hudair رضی اللہ عنہ said (to `Aisha رضی اللہ عنہا), "May Allah reward you handsomely. By Allah, whenever you have a difficulty, Allah took you out of it and brought with it, a Blessing for the Muslims."

When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was in his fatal illness, he started visiting his wives and saying, "Where will I be tomorrow?" He was anxious to be in `Aisha's home. `Aisha رضی اللہ عنہا said, "So when it was my day, the Prophet became silent (no longer asked the question).

The people used to send presents to the Prophet (ﷺ) on the day of `Aisha's turn. `Aisha رضی اللہ عنہا said, "My companions (i.e. the other wives of the Prophet) gathered in the house of Um Salama رضی اللہ عنہا and said, "O Um Salama! By Allah, the people choose to send presents on the day of `Aisha's turn and we too, love the good (i.e. presents etc.) as `Aisha رضی اللہ عنہا does. You should tell Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) to tell the people to send their presents to him wherever he may be, or wherever his turn may be." Um Salama رضی اللہ عنہا said that to the Prophet and he turned away from her, and when the Prophet (ﷺ) returned to her (i.e. Um Salama), she repeated the same, and the Prophet (ﷺ) again turned away, and when she told him the same for the third time, the Prophet (ﷺ) said, "O Um Salama! Don't trouble me by harming `Aisha رضی اللہ عنہا , for by Allah, the Divine Inspiration never came to me while I was under the blanket of any woman amongst you except her."

I asked Anas رضی اللہ عنہ , "Tell me about the name 'Al-Ansar.; Did you call yourselves by it or did Allah call you by it?" He said, "Allah called us by it." We used to visit Anas رضی اللہ عنہ (at Basra) and he used to narrate to us the virtues and deeds of the Ansar, and he used to address me or a person from the tribe of Al-Azd and say, "Your tribe did so-and-so on such-and-such a day."
chapterEnglish: Merits of the Helpers in Madinah (Ansaar)

hadithEnglish: The day of Bu'ath (i.e. Day of fighting between the two tribes of the Ansar, the Aus and Khazraj) was brought about by Allah for the good of His Apostle so that when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) reached (Medina), the tribes of Medina had already divided and their chiefs had been killed and wounded. So Allah had brought about the battle for the good of H is Apostle in order that they (i.e. the Ansar) might embrace Islam.
chapterEnglish: Merits of the Helpers in Madinah (Ansaar)

hadithEnglish: On the day of the Conquest of Mecca, when the Prophet (ﷺ) had given (from the booty) the Quraish, the Ansar said, "By Allah, this is indeed very strange: While our swords are still dribbling with the blood of Quraish, our war booty are distributed amongst them." When this news reached the Prophet (ﷺ) he called the Ansar and said, "What is this news that has reached me from you?" They used not to tell lies, so they replied, "What has reached you is true." He said, "Doesn't it please you that the people take the booty to their homes and you take Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) to your homes? If the Ansar took their way through a valley or a mountain pass, I would take the Ansar's valley or a mountain pass."
chapterEnglish: Merits of the Helpers in Madinah (Ansaar)

englishNarrator: Narrated Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) or Abul-Qasim said, "If the Ansar took their way through a valley or a mountain pass, I would take Ansar's valley. And but for the migration, I would have been one of the Ansar." Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ used to say, "The Prophet (ﷺ) is not unjust (by saying so). May my parents be sacrificed for him, for the Ansar sheltered and helped him," or said a similar sentence.
chapterEnglish: Merits of the Helpers in Madinah (Ansaar)
